marketNews.title: Economic Policy Package 2025
marketNews.content:
The government on Monday (16/12) announced a series of economic policy packages and a selective 12% value-added tax (VAT) for 2025. The important notes are as follows:

- Selective 12% VAT: The government said that the increase of VAT to 12% will only be applied to luxury or premium goods and services. Based on the press conference briefing, the items that will be subject to the 12% VAT are:
  - Premium rice, premium fruits, and premium meat (such as wagyu)
  - Expensive fish, shrimp, and premium crustaceans (such as king crab)
  - Premium education services
  - Premium health services
  - Electricity tariff for customers with a category of 3,500-6,600 VA
The government has not announced a complete list of luxury goods and services that will be subject to the 12% VAT. Meanwhile, the government will bear a 1 percentage point increase in VAT (VAT DTP) for wheat flour, industrial sugar, and cooking oil Minyakita, so their VAT will remain at 11%. Basic food items such as rice, meat, fish, eggs, vegetables, and milk will remain exempt from VAT.

- Food and Electricity Assistance: The government will provide food assistance in the form of rice amounting to 10 kg per month for 2 months (January and February 2025) for 16 million recipients. In addition, the government will also provide a 50% electricity tariff discount for 2 months (January and February 2025) for customers with a category of 2,200 VA or below, covering approximately 80 million customers or about 97% of PLN customers.

- Support for the Labor-Intensive Sector: The government will bear income tax (PPh 21) for workers in the labor‑intensive sector with salaries up to 10 million rupiah per month. In addition, labor‑intensive industries that wish to revitalize machinery will receive a special interest rate incentive of 5%.

- Extension of Property Sector Incentives: The government again extended the 100% VAT DTP exemption for landed houses and apartment units until June 2025. For the period July‑December 2025, the incentive will be reduced to a 50% VAT DTP exemption. The incentive applies to housing with a maximum selling price of 5 billion rupiah for the first 2 billion rupiah.

- Hybrid Car Incentive: The government will bear a 3% luxury vehicle tax (PPnBM) for hybrid cars. Consequently, the PPnBM for hybrid cars will drop from the current 7‑8% to 4‑5%. However, there is still uncertainty regarding a possible increase in the PPnBM for hybrid cars.

- Extension of UMKM Incentive: The government will extend the 0.5% tax exemption for micro, small and medium enterprises (UMKM) with annual turnover up to 4.8 billion rupiah for one additional year, specifically for UMKM that have already enjoyed the maximum 7‑year incentive. With this extension, UMKM that have already received the 7‑year incentive will obtain an additional one‑year duration. For UMKM that are newly receiving the incentive and have been under the program for less than 7 years, the tax incentive will remain at the maximum 7‑year period.

- Tobacco Excise Duty: The government confirmed that it will not raise the tobacco excise duty (CHT) in 2025. It also confirmed that the retail price of cigarettes and electronic cigarettes will be increased in 2025. On average, the retail price of cigarettes will rise by 4% in 2025 (excluding electronic cigarettes and other tobacco products). The cigarette type with the highest percentage increase is hand‑rolled kretek (SKT), especially in groups II and III. Meanwhile, the average retail price of electronic cigarettes will increase by 11% in 2025. These provisions will take effect on 1 January 2025.

- Interest Rate Outlook: Reuters‑surveyed economists expect Bank Indonesia to keep the benchmark BI Rate at 6% in the Governor’s Board meeting on 18 December 2024. This expectation differs from the previous month, when economists anticipated a 25 basis‑point rate cut in December 2024. The shift is driven by the continued weakening of the rupiah against the US dollar. Economists also lowered the expected BI Rate cuts for 2025 from 100 basis points to 75 basis points, considering potential longer‑term dollar strength due to protectionist policies of the newly elected US President Donald Trump.

- Trade Balance: BPS reported that Indonesia’s trade surplus surged to 4.42 billion US dollars in November 2024 (versus 2.48 billion in October 2024 and 2.41 billion in November 2023), exceeding the consensus estimate of 2.21 billion and marking the largest surplus since July 2024. The result was supported by a 9.14% year‑on‑year increase in exports, while imports rose only 0.01% year‑on‑year. Over the first 11 months of 2024, the trade surplus amounted to 28.89 billion US dollars, with exports up 2.06% year‑on‑year and imports up 4.74% year‑on‑year.

- China Retail Sales: China’s National Bureau of Statistics reported that retail sales growth slowed to 3% year‑on‑year in November 2024 (down from 4.8% in October 2024), below the consensus forecast of 4.6%. This marks the weakest retail sales growth since August 2024. On a monthly basis, retail sales fell 0.16% in November 2024. Over the first 11 months of 2024, China’s retail sales grew 3.5% year‑on‑year.

tickerNews.title: Key Takeaway: Policy Package Impact on INDF, ICBP, MYOR, and TSPC
tickerNews.content: Overall, we assess that this policy package will support the purchasing power of lower‑middle‑income households, which could have a positive impact on issuers such as INDF, ICBP, MYOR, and TSPC. However, there remains uncertainty regarding the 12% VAT burden on society, whether it will apply only to the five items listed above or to all goods and services outside wheat flour, industrial sugar, and cooking oil Minyakita as well as basic food items. Therefore, investors still need to wait for the official regulation to see the complete list of goods and services that will be subject to the 12% VAT.

tickerNews.title: GZCO Capital Injection into PT Sinar Karya Mandiri
tickerNews.content: Gozco Plantations (GZCO) through its subsidiary PT Suryabumi Agrolanggeng injected capital of 370 billion rupiah into its business entity PT Sinar Karya Mandiri. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Suryabumi Agrolanggeng in PT Sinar Karya Mandiri increased from 99.8% to 99.9%. PT Sinar Karya Mandiri is a palm oil plantation company in Ketapang, West Kalimantan. The transaction aims to strengthen the capital structure of PT Sinar Karya Mandiri.

tickerNews.title: FASW Plans Rights Issue of Up to 1 Billion New Shares
tickerNews.content: Fajar Surya Wisesa (FASW) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to 1 billion new shares with a dilution effect of up to 28.75%. The ratio and execution price have not been announced, while the proceeds are intended to reduce liabilities and increase working capital of the company. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary general meeting of shareholders on 22 January 2025.

tickerNews.title: BBRI Interim Dividend Rp135 per Share, Yield Indication 3.2%
tickerNews.content: BBRI: Bank Rakyat Indonesia will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to approximately 20.5 trillion rupiah or 135 rupiah per share. The cum‑date in the regular market and negotiation is 24 December 2024, with payment on 15 January 2025. Based on BBRI’s closing price on Monday (16/12) at 4,250 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 3.2%.

tickerNews.title: BBCA Reports November 2024 Net Profit of 4.2 Trillion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: BBCA: Bank Central Asia recorded a net profit (bank only) of 4.2 trillion rupiah (+8% YoY, -28% MoM) in November 2024. This result brings the net profit (bank only) for the 11‑month period 2024 to 50.5 trillion rupiah (+14% YoY), surpassing the consolidated FY24 growth estimate of the consensus at +13% YoY. Credit growth reached +15.5% YoY in the 11‑month period (vs. 10‑month: +14.2% YoY), exceeding the FY24 consolidated guidance of +10‑12%, with the loan‑to‑deposit ratio rising to 79% (vs. 10‑month: 78%). Net interest margin reached 5.73% in the 11‑month period (+22 bps YoY), in line with the FY24 consolidated guidance of 5.7‑5.8%. Credit cost (CoC) for the 11‑month period remained at 0.23% (-8 bps YoY), better than the FY24 consolidated guidance of 0.3‑0.4%.

tickerNews.title: RATU Plans IPO Offering Up to 543.01 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: RATU: The subsidiary of Rukun Raharja (RAJA), Raharja Energi Cepu (RATU), plans to carry out an IPO offering up to 543.01 million (20%) shares at a price of around 900‑1,150 rupiah per share, resulting in total proceeds of approximately 488.7‑624.5 billion rupiah. Of this amount, about 353 million (13%) shares represent a divestment of RAJA ownership, while the remainder are new shares. Consequently, the potential proceeds for RATU from this corporate action are estimated at 171‑218.6 billion rupiah, to be used for loans to two subsidiaries for cash‑call payments related to the management of the Jabung and Cepu blocks. Meanwhile, the proceeds for RAJA from the divestment are estimated at 317.7‑405.9 billion rupiah. RAJA will remain the controlling shareholder of RATU after the IPO with approximately 80% ownership. The public offering is scheduled for 2‑6 January 2025, with an expected listing on 8 January 2025.

tickerNews.title: MDKA Share Purchase by Saratoga Investama Sedaya
tickerNews.content: MDKA: Shareholder Merdeka Copper Gold, Saratoga Investama Sedaya (SRTG), purchased 53.4 million MDKA shares at a price of 2,273 rupiah per share on 13 December 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 121 billion rupiah. After this transaction, SRTG’s ownership in MDKA increased from 18.96% to 19.18%.

tickerNews.title: PSAB Targets 230‑240 Million USD Revenue in 2024
tickerNews.content: PSAB: The director of J Resources Asia Pacific, Sanjaya J., said that the company targets revenue of around 230‑240 million US dollars in 2024, growing +35‑41% YoY, although he did not provide further details on net profit projection. Sanjaya also mentioned that PSAB is optimistic about achieving gold production of the 2024 target of 100,000 ounces, a growth of +6% YoY. During the 11‑month period 2024, PSAB produced 93,027 ounces of gold, equivalent to 93% of the 2024 target, with an average selling price of 2,300 US dollars per ounce. Looking ahead, PSAB aims to maintain production around 100,000 ounces in 2025.

tickerNews.title: NCKL Acquires 10% Stake in PT Obi Nickel Cobalt
tickerNews.content: NCKL: Trimegah Bangun Persada announced that it has purchased a 10% stake in PT Obi Nickel Cobalt from affiliate Li Yuen Pte. Ltd., valued at approximately 2.1 trillion rupiah. After this transaction, NCKL’s ownership in PT Obi Nickel Cobalt becomes 20%. NCKL stated that the transaction was carried out considering the promising business development potential of PT Obi Nickel Cobalt.

tickerNews.title: BSDE Announces Mandatory Tender Offer for Remaining SMDM Shares
tickerNews.content: BSDE: Bumi Serpong Damai announced that it will conduct a mandatory tender offer for the remaining shares of Suryamas Dutamakmur (SMDM) from 17 December 2024 to 15 January 2025 at a price of 531 rupiah per share. This price is 2.12% higher than the SMDM closing price on Monday (16/12) at 520 rupiah per share. This corporate action is part of the acquisition of 91.99% of SMDM shares by BSDE valued at 2.3 trillion rupiah in October 2024.

tickerNews.title: KARW Shares Sold by PT Saranakelola Investa
tickerNews.content: KARW: The controlling shareholder of Meratus Jasa Prima, PT Saranakelola Investa, sold approximately 5.4 million KARW shares at an average price of 6,376 rupiah per share between 6‑11 December 2024. The total transaction value reached about 34.4 billion rupiah and was aimed at expanding the retail investor shareholder base. After this transaction, PT Saranakelola Investa’s ownership in KARW decreased from 80.28% to 79.14%.
